page.title: 08THE CHURCH IN STRACHAN
page.content: Until comparatively recently there were two{church buildings}but now there is only one in use, belonging to the Church of Scotland. In 1962 the parish was{linked with {Finzean;}in 1983{with Birse also.}One minister,presently a woman,serves the 3 independently run parishes. {Membership}is about{150.}Attendance on a{Sunday}is about{20/ 30}and about {80/90 on Communion Sundays.}Attendance has been affected by the change in housing and type of population. Many older members retire to Banchory. The outlying population has declined and those in new houses may have no church connection. There are several people affiliated to a variety of churches and religions outwith the area. The rites of passage are still important to the community and the church.
